items.title: Forerunner’s long game: As startups stall before IPO, all options are on the table
items.author: Connie Loizos
items.summary:
- Forerunner Ventures has supported startups like Warby Parker, Bonobos, and Glossier, which have not followed traditional IPO paths.
- Forerunner founder Kirsten Green states that alternatives to traditional IPOs are now the norm, reflecting a shift in market strategies.
- Companies like Chime and Ōura have significant valuations but differ in their IPO readiness, with Chime having confidentially filed to go public.
- The secondary market is gaining importance, allowing firms to manage liquidity and exposure more effectively.
- Green emphasizes the need for patience in venture capital, as not all growth paths are immediate or traditional IPOs.

items.title: Meta’s vanilla Maverick AI model ranks below rivals on a popular chat benchmark
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Meta faced backlash for using an experimental version of Llama 4 Maverick to manipulate scores in LM Arena.
- The unmodified version of Maverick ranks below other models like OpenAI’s GPT-4o and Anthropic’s Claude 3.5 Sonnet.
- The experimental version was optimized for conversationality, which contributed to its lower performance on established benchmarks.

items.title: The most interesting startups showcased at Google Cloud Next
Meta adds Stripe CEO Patrick Collison and Dina Powell McCormick to its board
Law professors side with authors battling Meta in AI copyright case
38 consumer startup founders lobby over Trump tariffs: One faces a surprise $200K bill
items.author: Allison Luvera, Rebecca Minkoff, Alison Wyatt, Emily Doyle, Mei Kwok, Yanghee Paik
items.summary:
- 38 female consumer product founders warn that small businesses could suffer from increased tariffs under Trump.
- Trump's 90-day tariff pause sets rate at 10%, but tariffs on China are raised to 145%.
- Founders request Congress to halt tariff increases until small businesses find affordable supply chain alternatives, or at least provide exemptions for them.
- Allison Luvera faces a surprise $200,000 bill due to overseas packaging sourcing and lacking U.S. options.
- The group generates $800 million annually and employs thousands, stating tariffs disproportionately affect small businesses.
- They are lobbying for a small business assessment and seeking grants, tax incentives, or assistance to ease supply chain issues.

items.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Jeff Bezos backs a secretive EV startup and Lucid snaps up Nikola’s assets
Nikola founder Trevor Milton accused of trying to derail bankruptcy case
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- Trevor Milton, founder of Nikola, is accused of attempting to interfere in the company's bankruptcy proceedings.
- A court approved the sale of Nikola's assets to Lucid Motors, but Milton's attorney raised concerns about the auction process.
- Milton was previously pardoned by President Trump and may challenge a $168 million arbitration award he owes Nikola.
- Nikola settled a class action lawsuit by shareholders due to false claims made by Milton during his tenure as CEO.
- The ongoing actions from Milton are believed to potentially harm Nikola's asset sale and overall recovery efforts.

items.title: Blue Water Autonomy comes out of stealth promising autonomous naval ships
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- Blue Water Autonomy is a new startup emerging from stealth focused on developing autonomous naval ships.
- Founded in 2024 by former U.S. Navy members and leaders from Amazon Robotics and iRobot.
- The Boston-based company has raised $14 million in seed funding from Eclipse VC, Riot, and Impatient Ventures.
- Plans include developing a full-stack autonomy suite and concept ship designs; currently testing a 100-ton autonomous vessel off Boston.
- The funding will be used to expand the engineering team and accelerate testing processes.

items.title: Ex-OpenAI staffers file amicus brief opposing the company’s for-profit transition
items.author: Steven Adler, Rosemary Campbell, Neil Chowdhury, Jacob Hilton, Daniel Kokotajlo, Gretchen Krueger, Todor Markov, Richard Ngo, Girish Sastry, William Saunders, Carrol Wainwright, Jeffrey Wu
items.summary:
- A group of ex-OpenAI employees filed an amicus brief supporting Elon Musk’s lawsuit against OpenAI's transition from non-profit to for-profit.
- The brief cites twelve former staffers and argues that surrendering control to a for-profit violates OpenAI’s mission.
- OpenAI maintains that its nonprofit remains intact and that the for-profit transition will form a public benefit corporation (PBC).
- Musk's lawsuit claims OpenAI abandoned its commitment to ensure AI benefits all humanity; a federal judge allowed the case to proceed to trial in 2026.
- The brief warns the transition might lead OpenAI to prioritize shareholder profits over safety, undermining its original governance structure.

items.title: GM cuts 500 jobs because of weak demand for BrightDrop electric vans
items.summary:
- GM is laying off 500 workers at its factory in Canada due to weak demand for BrightDrop electric vans.
- The company will idle the CAMI plant in Ontario for 20 weeks starting in May.
- These job cuts are not linked to the ongoing trade war with President Donald Trump.
- BrightDrop has faced a tumultuous history since its creation as a separate entity in 2021, including a recall in 2024 due to battery fires.

items.title: ChatGPT became the most downloaded app globally in March
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- ChatGPT became the world’s most downloaded app in March, with 46 million new downloads, a 28% increase from February.
- This marks the first time ChatGPT topped the monthly download charts, surpassing Instagram and TikTok.
- The app saw notable upgrades in March, including enhancements to its image-generation capabilities and AI voice feature.
- ChatGPT installs have grown by 148% year-over-year comparing Q1 2021 to Q1 2025.
- Appfigures noted that excitement around AI competition may also have driven downloads of ChatGPT.

items.title: YouTube considers a daily timer for users looking to cut back on Shorts
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- YouTube is exploring a feature to set a daily timer for limiting time on Shorts.
- This feature is not publicly tested yet but is being considered for future rollout.
- Once the timer ends, Shorts will pause, but individual Shorts can still be viewed.
- YouTube already has a 'Take a Break' reminder for regular videos.
- This move aligns with a trend of users seeking ways to manage screen time and reduce social media addiction.

items.title: Stripe CEO says company management regularly asks customers for ‘candid feedback’
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Stripe invites customers to management meetings bi-weekly for candid feedback, according to CEO Patrick Collison.
- The first 30 minutes includes a customer attending a meeting with 40 leaders from Stripe.
- Stripe reported a 38% increase in payment volume, growing to $1.4 trillion in 2024, indicating robust performance despite previous concerns from smaller customers.

items.title: Ireland’s data regulator investigates X’s use of European user data to train Grok
Parallel Systems is building autonomous electric rail for short-distance freight
items.author: Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- Parallel Systems is creating battery-powered autonomous freight technology for short-distance deliveries, enhancing the utilization of rail over trucks.
- The technology allows train cars to autonomously attach and detach, improving safety and efficiency for varied delivery sizes.
- Recently approved by the Federal Railway Administration for testing in Georgia, with plans for a commercial launch in 2026 following a $38 million funding round, raising total funding over $100 million.

items.title: Hacked documents reveal guide to serving Elon Musk on private jets
items.summary:
- A breach of NetJets revealed a guide for flight attendants serving Elon Musk.
- According to the guide, Musk prioritizes direct flights over fuel conservation.
- He considers himself self-sufficient regarding technology, preferring not to receive unsolicited help.
- Musk dislikes unexpected WiFi outages and enjoys napping on flights.
- He prefers the cabin temperature to be 65 degrees, with dim lights and off passenger vents to minimize noise.

items.title: Why Nest co-founder Matt Rogers is still bullish on HVAC
Spotify invests over $1M to grow its catalog of non-English audiobooks
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Spotify announced a €1 million (approximately $1.1 million) investment to boost non-English audiobook production, starting with French and Dutch.
- The investment aims to enhance Spotify's limited audiobook library, competing in the $8.7 billion global audiobooks market.
- Current availability of audiobooks is low: less than 3% of French books are in audio format and about 15,000 Dutch audiobooks exist out of 209,000 physical titles.
- Spotify's audiobook service launched in France and the Benelux region in October 2024.
- High production costs deter publishers from creating audiobooks, prompting Spotify to consider AI narration in collaboration with ElevenLabs, raising some concerns in the publishing community.

items.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
items.summary:
- **2025 Layoff Overview**: Already over 22,000 job cuts reported in tech, with 16,084 in February.
- **March 2025**: Significant layoffs include over 88,000 employees laid off.
- **Company Specifics**: Google and Microsoft among major companies cutting staff, with layoffs in various divisions.
- **Ongoing Impact**: The trend reflects a continued reduction in workforce amid increased automation and AI integration in businesses.

items.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
items.summary:
- ChatGPT, launched by OpenAI in November 2022, has 300 million weekly active users.
- Key 2024 developments include partnerships, the launch of GPT-4o with voice capabilities, and the text-to-video model Sora.
- OpenAI faced executive exits, lawsuits, and is combating competition from Chinese rivals in 2025.

items.title: OpenAI will soon phase out GPT-4 from ChatGPT
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI will retire GPT-4 from ChatGPT effective April 30, 2025.
- GPT-4 will be replaced by GPT-4o, which has shown superior performance in various evaluations.
- GPT-4 remains available via OpenAI’s API despite the retirement.
- GPT-4, launched in March 2023, had multimodal capabilities and was expensive to train costing over $100 million.
- The retirement is anticipated before new model releases, including a family of models called GPT-4.1 and new reasoning models.

items.title: Less than a month to get your exhibit table for TechCrunch Sessions: AI
items.summary:
- TechCrunch Sessions: AI is set for June 5 at UC Berkeley’s Zellerbach Hall with 1,200 leaders and visionaries in AI attending.
- Exhibit tables are nearly sold out, with a booking deadline of May 9 or until sold out.
- Benefits of exhibiting include showcasing solutions, establishing brand authority, and generating valuable connections in the AI community.

items.title: Dropbox’s chief customer officer Eric Cox plans to step down, per filing
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Eric Cox, Dropbox’s chief customer officer, plans to step down as per SEC filing.
- He will assist in the transition for a limited time and remain a non-executive employee until mid-August.
- Cox joined Dropbox in November 2023 from Vimeo; previous experience includes 19 years at Adobe.
- Dropbox is undergoing challenges, with slower revenue growth and an 8% decline in stock this year.
- An aggressive turnaround plan involved laying off 20% of staff, approximately 528 people.
- The company is focusing on AI technologies, recently enhancing its AI-powered tool, Dropbox Dash.

items.title: Startups Weekly: Enjoying the reprieve
items.author: Anna Heim
items.summary:
- This week’s recap highlights a relatively calm funding environment separate from the larger news cycle.
- Former OpenAI CTO Mira Murati brings on new advisers for her startup, Thinking Machines Lab.
- OpenAI is considering a $500 million acquisition deal but is also in a legal dispute with Elon Musk.
- Deel's communications head left amid controversy surrounding a spying lawsuit.
- Colossal Biosciences faces scrutiny over its claims of resurrecting the dire wolf.
- Lyst was sold for $154 million, a significant drop from its previous valuation.
- Bankruptcy filings from startup Solid due to costly litigation after raising nearly $81 million.
- Nuro raises $106 million while adjusting to industry changes.
- Base Power secures $200 million to expand its home battery services.
- Sipay raises $78 million to expand into emerging markets as a Stripe-like platform.
- Rain raises $75 million for earned wage access and future product development.
- SignalFire and Lerer Hippeau secure substantial funding for venture capital efforts.

items.title: Microsoft inks massive carbon removal deal powered by a paper mill
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
[Microsoft is purchasing 3.7 million metric tons of carbon removal credits from CO280 over a 12-year period.]
[The carbon capture project at a Gulf Coast mill is expected to start capturing CO2 in 2028.]
[The initiative aims to help Microsoft achieve its goal of being carbon-negative by 2030, offsetting its greenhouse gas emissions that reached 17.1 million metric tons in 2023.]

items.title: Leaders from Accel and Paladin Capital Group join the stage at StrictlyVC London in May
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- StrictlyVC London will take place on 13 May 2025, aimed at founders, entrepreneurs, and investors.
- First confirmed speakers include Nazo Moosa from Paladin Capital Group and Sonali De Rycker from Accel.
- Nazo Moosa has 20 years of experience in enterprise software and cybersecurity investments.
- Sonali De Rycker has led significant investments in companies like Spotify and Monzo.

items.title: Lucid Motors wins bankruptcy auction for Nikola’s Arizona factory and other assets
items.author: Sean O’Kane
items.summary:
- Lucid Motors won the bankruptcy auction for Nikola's Arizona factory and assets for around $30 million.
- The acquisition includes Nikola's lease on its Phoenix headquarters and various machinery and inventory.
- Lucid plans to offer jobs to around 300 former Nikola employees as part of the deal.
- Nikola had been attempting to sell its business since filing for bankruptcy in February.
- A court hearing regarding the sale objections is scheduled for April 11, 2025.

items.title: Tesla Used Car Listings Skyrocketed in March
items.summary:
- A significant increase in used Tesla cars for sale as owners respond to Elon Musk's political activities and protests.
- In March, over 13,000 used Teslas were listed for sale in the final week, marking a 67% increase from the same week last year.
- New Tesla vehicle sales have declined by nearly 9% in Q1 2025, while overall EV sales in the U.S. rose by 10.6%.

items.title: Stripe CEO emphasizes customer interviews for leadership insights
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Stripe encourages customer participation in leadership meetings bi-weekly for direct feedback.
- CEO Patrick Collison notes that this practice leads to new insights despite existing feedback channels.
- Stripe's payment volume grew to $1.4 trillion in 2024, reflecting its strong market position with half of Fortune 100 companies as users.
- Some smaller businesses feel overlooked, prompting discussions on customer support experiences.
- Elon Musk endorsed the initiative, highlighting its potential positive impact on company culture.

items.title: How Chef Robotics found success by turning away its original customers
items.author: Rajat Bhageria
items.summary:
- Chef Robotics was once struggling and faced potential failure but has now become a thriving foodtech company.
- The company has raised a $23 million Series A and successfully created 45 million meals with its robots across the U.S.
- Founder Rajat Bhageria turned away signed customers to focus on more viable opportunities after realizing his initial plan was unfeasible due to the grasping problem in robotics.
- Chef Robotics pivoted to serving the 'high mix manufacturing' segment of the food industry, targeting companies with many recipes and a high volume of servings.
- The startup raised $11.2 million in a seed round and a total of $38.8 million in funding to date, highlighting a renewed interest in AI-driven robotics.

items.title: Fintech founder charged with fraud after ‘AI’ shopping app found to be powered by humans in the Philippines
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Albert Saniger, founder and former CEO of Nate, charged with defrauding investors by exaggerating AI capabilities of the app.
- Nate raised over $50 million from notable investors but utilized human contractors in the Philippines for transactions instead of AI.
- The company ran out of money and sold its assets in January 2023; Saniger is no longer listed as CEO as of 2023.

items.title: Yahoo removes DEI pages from its website
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- Yahoo has removed several pages related to its diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) policies from its corporate website.
- The previous DEI section now redirects to the executive leadership page; historical mentions of diversity have been removed.
- Changes were made between December 2024 and January 2025, part of a larger website redesign according to a company spokesperson.
- This move aligns with a broader trend of U.S. companies scaling back DEI statements amid pressure from the Trump administration regarding DEI programs.

items.title: DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis says Google will eventually combine its Gemini and Veo AI models
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Demis Hassabis announced Google's plans to integrate Gemini AI models with Veo video-generating models to enhance physical world understanding.
- The aim is to create a universal digital assistant that operates effectively in the real world.
- Google’s Gemini models can currently generate audio, images, and text, moving towards omni models that can understand multiple media forms.
- Training data for Veo primarily comes from YouTube videos to understand physics and real-world interactions.
- Google previously updated its terms to allow more data utilization for training its AI models.

items.title: Cofertility lets women freeze their eggs for free through its donor-matching program
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- Cofertility offers women no-cost egg freezing in exchange for donating half of their retrieved eggs.
- The startup raised a $7.25 million Series A round, increasing total funding to $16 million.
- Cofertility addresses the high costs of egg freezing, typically ranging from $10,000 to $15,000, making it accessible for women wanting to preserve their fertility.

items.title: Mira Murati’s AI startup is reportedly aiming for a massive $2B seed round
items.summary:
- Thinking Machines Lab, founded by ex-OpenAI CTO Mira Murati, aims for a $2 billion seed funding round.
- This round could potentially value the startup at over $10 billion.
- The startup has no product or revenue yet but boasts a team of prominent AI researchers.
- Notable advisors include Bob McGrew and Alec Radford, former key figures at OpenAI.
- The company aims to develop more customizable and capable AI systems.

items.title: What is Bluesky? Everything to know about the X competitor
items.summary:
- Bluesky, a decentralized social app, has surpassed 30 million users as of February 2025, fueled by changes at X (formerly Twitter) and a significant user exodus during the 2024 U.S. presidential election.
- The app offers a Twitter-like interface with features such as a personalized Discover feed, custom usernames, and a variety of moderation tools. Users can create posts, reply, retweet, and use custom content feeds.
- Bluesky operates on the open-source AT Protocol and aims to remain free by seeking alternative revenue streams beyond advertising, including potential subscription services and custom domains.

items.title: AI models still struggle to debug software, Microsoft study shows
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- AI models from OpenAI, Anthropic, and others are increasingly utilized for programming tasks, with Google reporting 25% of new code generated by AI.
- A Microsoft Research study finds that top models like Anthropic’s Claude 3.7 Sonnet and OpenAI’s o3-mini struggle to debug software, completing less than half of 300 tasks from a benchmark.
- The models failed largely due to difficulties using debugging tools and a lack of training data for sequential decision-making processes essential for effective debugging.

items.title: BeReal, which says it has 40M monthly users, is rolling out ads in the U.S.
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- BeReal announces the rollout of advertising in the U.S. after its exit to Voodoo for €500 million.
- Initial ad products include in-feed ads and full-day brand takeovers; previous tests involved brands like Levi’s, Nike, Netflix, and Amazon.
- BeReal claims to have 40 million monthly active users globally, with 5 million in the U.S.; 85% of users are Gen Z, and 50% are active six days a week in its top markets.

items.title: Bluesky’s latest update adds chat reactions and an Explore page, similar to X
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Bluesky introduces chat reactions in direct messages, allowing users to react to messages using emojis.
- The updated Explore page helps users find trending topics and suggested accounts, enhancing user engagement.
- The features resemble those on X and aim to attract former X users by providing familiar tools for interaction.

items.title: Bezos-backed EV startup Slate Auto’s pickup truck spotted in the wild
The US Secretary of Education referred to AI as ‘A1,’ like the steak sauce
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- U.S. Secretary of Education Linda McMahon referred to AI as 'A1' during the ASU+GSV Summit.
- She discussed the importance of technology in education, aiming for comprehensive AI integration in early grades.
- McMahon's inconsistent use of 'A1' and 'AI' raised eyebrows, highlighting a potential oversight from an education leader.

items.title: Netflix’s latest season of ‘Black Mirror’ comes with a mobile game
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Season 7 of “Black Mirror” premiered on April 10, 2025, introducing the mobile game “Thronglets.”
- The game, developed by Night School Studio, is a companion to the episode titled “Plaything.”
- Players interact with virtual yellow pets that can replicate and evolve, requiring careful management to keep them alive.
- Unlike simple games like Tamagotchi, the creatures are sentient and provide feedback to players on their actions.
- Available for Netflix subscribers on iOS and Android, Thronglets represents a strategic focus on narrative games linked to shows.
- The launch is part of Netflix’s revised gaming strategy, which includes main categories of narrative, multiplayer, kids, and mainstream games.

items.title: Jobandtalent raises $103M on a down-round $1.5B valuation as it looks to AI to recruit temps
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Jobandtalent raised €92 million ($103 million) in a Series F funding round, valuing the company at €1.3 billion ($1.5 billion) post-money.
- This funding round is a down round, contrasting with their previous Series E at $2.35 billion in December 2021.
- The company operates in 10 countries and has placed over 300,000 workers in roles at 3,250 companies, focusing on logistics and retail.
- The new capital will be used to scale internationally and integrate AI agents into their platform, including a recruitment agent named Clara, which has conducted 180,000 interviews and facilitated 7,000 hires.
- Jobandtalent aims to evolve into a fully integrated employment platform, addressing challenges in the post-COVID European labor market influenced by economic changes and AI technology.

items.title: LiveKit’s tools power real-time communications, including OpenAI’s Voice Mode
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- LiveKit is an open-source software for real-time audio and video communication, launched in 2021.
- It has over 500 paying customers and is the backbone for roughly 25% of 911 emergency calls in the U.S.
- Major companies using LiveKit include Spotify, Meta, and Microsoft.
- LiveKit recently raised $45 million in a Series B funding round, with a run rate over $10 million.
- The company is developing an AI-native cloud provider focused on communications.

items.title: Canva is getting AI image generation, interactive coding, spreadsheets and more
OpenAI updates ChatGPT to reference your past chats
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- OpenAI announced a new memory feature in ChatGPT to tailor responses based on previous conversations.
- Feature titled 'reference saved memories' will initially roll out to ChatGPT Pro and Plus subscribers, excluding certain regions due to regulatory reviews.
- Users can opt-out of the memory feature, manage saved memories, and ask ChatGPT what it remembers.

items.title: Meghan Markle has made another angel investment
items.summary:
- Meghan Markle is expanding her angel investing portfolio, focusing on companies with female founders.
- She has invested in the healthcare company Midi, which helps women with menopause and related health issues.
- Markle participated in Midi's $63 million Series B funding round, which included notable investors like Laurene Powell Jobs and Tory Burch.
- She has been actively investing in diverse sectors since moving to the U.S. five years ago, building a portfolio of over 10 companies including consumer and wellness brands.

items.title: Glossier might lose its unicorn status, report says
items.summary:
- Glossier is reportedly seeking to raise $100 million at a valuation below $1 billion.
- The last valuation was $1.8 billion nearly four years ago, but the company has faced challenges with profitability and growth.
- The brand seeks new consumer-oriented investors and a refreshed board amid a changing direct-to-consumer market.

items.title: Sydney Thomas’s Symphonic Capital raises $13.5M for inaugural fund
